minid.net: Diego Lafuente's personal blog

Hello, I'm Diego Lafuente, a designer and developer in Barcelona working as Head of Product. I write about business, design, history, technology and other topics.

Latest on the blog

historia

La superstición en Roma y los Libros Sibilinos (Jan 05)

Leyendo los relatos de históricos uno se da cuenta que en los romanos el nivel de superstición era muy alto, pero, mucho. Tanto, que hoy en día con toda probabilidad nos causaría gracia leer en una revista o un periódico que un ciudadano haya sacrificado una vaca para calmar la ira de un Dios y así traer más empleos a la ciudad. En la Antigua Roma en cambio esto no era tan gracioso y elocuente.

Content

You can read more about me and also have a full list of my proffesional career.

Frameworks

  • Utilitarian CSS FramworksNew!: UCSSM is a CSS framework and a methodology for developing responsive, mobile first projects on the web.
  • Flexsasscandy: Grid based on the flex display property using Sass and BEM naming convention.
  • Android Vector Universal Interface Kit: AVUIK is a complete, public domain licensed, illustration set of the latest Android Universal Interface theme called Holo, wich is available on Android KitKat and that you can use freely on Sketch App (version 3.0). 139 stars +9 forks
  • UiUIKit (Universal iPhone UI Kit): It's a collection of HTML examples of what can be done with CSS3 and Safari's Webkit. With this framework you can. This project has +250k downloads. 323 stars rating in Google Code.

Companies

  • Fotolog.com: the online photo diary with +40M registered users from all around the world.
  • Furgo: It is a platform for transporting objects of all kinds. Created and launched in April 2015, today it continues to operate throughout the Spanish territory.
  • Tractis (2007-2012). Digital signature platform and services. Valued at 12M.
  • Mercadelia (2008). Online listings.
